description:
Svarozhich surveys the world and is not pleased. He plans to cleanse the world with fire. Rasputin reveals more startling revelations about the true nature of Firestorm to Ron and Mikhail. With the help of Serafina and Dmitri, Ron and Mikhail form Firestorm and confront Svarozhich. Ron and Mikhail are faced with a decision that may have life-altering potential.

Firestorm826's Panel-by-Panel Story Summary (Spoiler Alert)

FZAAM! The God of Fire materializes in the City of Lights. He claims the city as part of his demesne and examines it, all in the same moment. And what he sees does not please him.

FZAAP! So the Russian God of Fire comes to the Big Apple. FZAAM! What he sees here pleases him even less. He continues his journey. Svarozhichâs journey takes him elsewhere around the world. He sees the squalor, the overpopulation, the stripping of the landâs natural resources. Wells tap oil deposits like veins and bleed them dry. The sea roils, soiled and dying. Even atop the landâs highest peak, the air is polluted. There is no place you can stand on the planet and breathe truly clean air. And the God is angry.

At last, the God returns from where he began his journey. âEverywhere I look the humans crawl like maggots. And everything they touch is blight,â Svarozhich says. He hovers in the night sky over Moscow. âI know now why I was awakened. The world needs a cleansing,â he continues. âA cleansing by fire. A fire to clear away the clutter and undergrowth, to ripen the new seeds and give them room to grow. A fire to transform the world.â He looks up to the sky and stretches his arms out. Fire begins to swirl and flow away from him, quickly spreading far over the city.

The home of Rasputin. âGet out of here!â Mikhail scoffs at Rasputin.

âI tell you again - - everything you think you know about Firestorm is wrong!â Rasputin argues. âDmitri, it is necessary that all minds are linked together again, for you all have parts to play if Firestorm is to live again. And for the sake of all who live, it is necessary Firestorm live again!â

Dmitri performs the mental link between the group and Rasputin begins to explain. âFirst, you must know, I am a dabbler in the mystic arts, a seeker of knowledge, a catspaw - - if you will - - for fate,â he tells them telepathically. âThere are others like myself: Of my own certain knowledge there is an impertinent bumbler in England as well as a dilettante in Washington.â

Rasputin reaches a hand out to Ronâs shoulder. âKnowledge is what we most require now,â he continues in their thoughts. âSomewhere locked within you, is the truth that I suspect exists. You block it subconsciously now. It is necessary for you to relive it - - to relive all the events that happened the moment that Firestorm was born.â

âYou will need another mind to guide yours,â Rasputin says.

âMaybe,â Ron answers. âBut I donât trust you or Dmitri inside my head.â

âIf our American friend will permit me, I will do it,â offers Serafina telepathically.

âI guess..,â Ron answers.

Serafina turns and places her hands on each side of Ronâs head. âThen relax. Let my mind meld with yours,â she directs him. âCast your thoughts back to the incident in the nuclear facility, to the explosion that created Firestorm.â

âOkayâ¦Iâm there,â Ron says, closing his eyes to concentrate.

âTime will slow and you will experience nanoseconds passing. We will experience everything with you.â

In Ronâs mind, he sees himself lying on the floor in the atomic pile room. Just to his side is the dynamite charge set by Eddie Earhart and his gang. In slow-motion, Ron relives the explosion.

âIâ¦Iâm being ripped apart! I can feel it!â he gasps. âThe pain! Dear Lord, the pain! Someoneâ¦somethingâ¦there!â

Two radiant hands reach out to Ronâs head in the midst of the explosion. VIHAAAAAAA! âThereâs a changeâ¦Iâm being brought back together..!â Ron says. ROOOOOOM! âNo! Going too far! Merging!â he cries out. In his mind, he sees Firestorm standing and laughing.

âThatâs him! The other one I sense in your Firestorm matrix!â Serafina says quickly. âThe creature that caused you to merge! That was him!â

âI understand now why it has been so hard to uncover this one,â Rasputin says, holding his hand to his chin in thought. âMore than one consciousness was involved. And, I suspect, its true target was the man Stein. Your mind took precedence because you were awake during the transformation. You are a child of your media, of the American idolatry of the meta-human. You made what you became into a superhero because that was the only way you could explain these âpowersâ you were given. The addition of Mikhail Denisvoitch changed the matrix, allowed the creature to come closer to the surface, using the amnesiac mind of this Stein as the template for its own consciousness. Yes, it all fits!â

âWhy did Jama enter thisâ¦ âmatrixâ, as you call it?â Mikhail asks.

âThe entity was trying still to assert itself,â Rasputin explains. âThe sympathy between the African and the American, the physical contact, the presence of fire - - all were factors.â

âSo what is this entity?â Ron asks.

âLink minds again so you may understand,â Rasputin directs. Serafina makes the telepathic connection. âThe entity has walked the Earth before in different guises,â Rasputin continues. âAll nations have legendsâ¦mythsâ¦about him. The Greeks called him Prometheus, the giver of the gift of fire. The Norse knew a different aspect of the entity and called him Surtur, who would cleanse the world by flame after the twilight of the gods.â

âI am a student of comparative religions, though a believer in none of them,â Rasputin continues. âThe entity that formed Firestorm has been known in many religions, sometimes as lifegiver, sometimes as destroyer, much like fire itself - - a servant when controlled, a force of destruction when it is not. The Earth raises spirits of itself to defend and protect in times of need - - these spirits fuse with mortals to for avatars. Such entities are called Elementals.â

Rasputin pictures Firestorm, Red Tornado, and Swamp Thing in his mind and the others see it through the telepathic link. âI had identified the Elementals of Earth and Air,â Rasputin explains. âI knew Fire had emerged but was not certain where. Now I do; the Fire Elemental is the being you know as Firestorm.â

âHoly moley!â Ron blurts.

âIf what you say is true, then how was the Svarozhich creature able to steal this Fire Elemental from us?!â Mikahil asks in disbelief.

âSvarozhich is a clone infused with Firestormâs cells, taken during the metagene bomb aftermath,â Rasputin answers. âThe creature is physically compatible with the entityâs needs but lacks your human scruples. The entity is freer to act in the Svarozhich persona. That is what it seeks. The human side of the Fire Elemental is absolutely necessary - - itâs the difference between Prometheus and Surtur. Fire - - controlled - - is a friend and servant to man. Unchecked, it can be his destroyer. We must find this Svarozhich and you two must reclaim Firestorm. To this end, both your powers, Serafina, and yours, Dmitri, will be needed. Come!â

Rasputin leads them to the door and they put on their coats. âI will tell you this now, Ronald Raymond and Mikhail Denisovitch,â he explains. âAll our hopes lie in you. And your only hope, ultimately, lies in surrender. Complete and utter surrender. Nowâ¦we go to find the false God of Fire.â

Heâs not hard to find. The group walks outside and sees fire raging across the city. âBozhe moi!â Mikhail gasps at the sight. âI think heâs somewhere around here, guys.â

Out of the sky, four armored figures fly into the area and approach Svarozhich. âLook! Rocket Reds!â Serafina cries out.

The Rocket Reds form to attack. Svarozhich aims his hands at them. FZAAM! Svarozhich launches a fire burst! BUHROOOM! It explodes, blasting the Rocket Reds away. âAAIIEEE!â one yells as he falls from the sky.

âSo much for the charge of the heavy brigade,â Ron observes.

âDmitri, Serafinaâ¦use your psi powers to shield our presence from Svarozhich,â Rasputing directs.

âHe already knows. He doesnât care,â Serafina answers.

FOOMP! Svarozhich flies down near them. WHOOMP! Fire flows down from him and begins to burn the area around the group.

âDmitri, Serafina - - link our thoughts!â Rasputin urges. The link is formed.

âI have determined to cleanse the world by flame, to clear away the deadwood humanity has created and let new life rise,â Svarozhich announces, hovering above them. âI was content to let you perish with your world, but since you have come to me to be sacrificed I will not refuse your gift. Come and be consumed.â

âArkadin! Raymond! Concentrate now on forming Firestorm!â Rasputin orders. Ron and Mikhail join hands and try to fuse.

âHa ha ha ha ha!â laughs Svarozhich. âYou would steal back what once was yours?! Insipid and futile! Your wills combined are no longer enough!â

âNow! Serafina, Dmitri - - bend your wills with Mikhail and the American!â Rasputin instructs. âConcentrate on bringing the Elemental back to them!â

Svarozhich feels the effect. âNo!â he yells. âI will not allow this!â FZAAM! He launches another burst of fire.

âThe wall of flames! It closes in!â Dmitri yells.

âDonât break, Uncle Dmitri!â Serafina pleads. âConcentrate on what we must do!â

âYour uncle has failed us, girl!â Rasputin snarls, smacking across Dmitriâs head. âIt is now all up to you!â

âNo! Weâll be burned alive! Uhnng!â groans Dmitri as he staggers and falls from the blow.

âThen I shall have to suffice,â Serafina says, concentrating as hard as she can to focus on Ron and Mikhail.

âI - - will - - not - - yield!!!â yells Svarozhich.

FOOMP! Light radiates and envelops Ron and Mikhail. âUncle Mikhail!!!â Serafina cries out.

FZAAM! Firestorm appears. He leaps into the air. âGo to safety. I will deal with my doppelganger,â he directs the others.

Svarozhich fires a burst at Firestorm. âWhen I have killed you, the power will come back to me!â Svarozhich says.

âYou must touch what you would destroy,â Firestorm answers as he dodges the attack.

FZAAK! Svarozhich fires again, this time hitting Firestorm! âAAAGH!â Firestorm yells as he is struck in the chest. He starts to fall.

âI can touch you,â Svarozhich says. âYour density was near zero but was not at zero! I know your tricks! I was you! I struck at your very molecular bonding! Next time, I will dissolve them - - and you shall truly cease to be!â

âYou stole the power from me last time because I was unprepared! Not this time!â Firestorm answers. FASHHH! He fires a nuclear burst at Svarozhich.

âThe power calls to me!â Svarozhich says, descending toward Firestorm. âIt yearns to burn free - - unrestrained by your petty humanity! I am the rightful Lord of Fire!â

Firestorm grapples with Svarozhich. âProve it,â Firestorm replies. FZAAP! FZAAM! WHOOOOOOO! Winds sweep around the two combatants, forming a tornado of fire as they clash. KRAKADOOM!

âChild, link me with the minds of your uncle and the American in Firestorm!â Rasputin requests. âNow - - before the city is destroyed and our chance is lost!â

âA-Alright,â Serafina answers as she watched the fiery battle.

âYou who are Firestorm, listen to me!â Rasputin says telepathically. âThis is Rasputin! You cannot win! You and your doppler are too evenly matched! Your only hope is surrender! But not to Svarozhich! You must surrender to the Fire Elemental - - to Firestorm! You have always held something back of yourselves, never surrendering your identities, your sense of self! The meld has never been complete and now - - to defeat Svarozhich - - it must be! Even if it means you never return to your own lives, you must surrender to Firestorm! Otherwise, Svarozhich must inevitably win the struggle! Are you willing?â

âTo say yes is to bid farewell to my family - - never to hold my children again; to abandon all hope that Nina and I can be reconciled,â Mikhail answers. âTo say no is to condemn them and all that lives to death. What choice is there but to say - - I agree. I consent.â

âYou donât know what youâre asking. To give up and sense of freedom, any feeling of independence - - itâs like giving up life itself!â Ron answers. âYet, am I willing to let everything else die, just so that I can live? Itâs so tempting but - - not even I am so selfish. Yes, Iâll surrenderâ¦â

Firestorm and Svarozhich stand close together with their hands interlocked. âAnd you! Svarozhich - - will you enter our meld as well?â Firestorm asks him. âOur struggle is useless. We are the same being after all.â

ââ¦Yes..,â Svarozhich answers.

SHOOOMP! WHOOOOOOOOSH! Bright light coalesces around Firestorm and Svarozhich. Serafina and Rasputin shield their eyes from the incredible brightness. A single figure descends from the point of fusion, coming down to land in front of Serafina and Rasputin.

âAreâ¦Are you Firestorm?â Rasputin asks.

âYes. As I was always meant to be,â Firestorm replies.

âUncle?â Serafina asks.

Firestorm reaches out his hand and touches her shoulder. âYes. And no. I am not him, though he is a part of me,â he explains. âI am one of this planetâs defenders - - a planet much abused and misused in recent times. But I also know what it is to be human - - of the hopes and dreams mankind possesses. I can be mankindâs friend but I can also be mankindâs scourge. The final decision on which I shall be rests, I suspect, with humanity.â He turns and flies up into the night.

âChild, why do you weep? Firestorm lives and the world - - for now - - is safe,â Rasputin asks.

âI scanned the creature for some trace of my uncle and I found nothing - - nothing!â Serafina answers through her tears.

At the Trofimovâs dacha in Arkangel, Nina awakens. âWhat is that bright light in the childrenâs room?â she thinks. She walks to their room and opens the door. Inside, she sees the newly transformed Firestorm standing next to the children. He holds his hands over them and energy flows in a bright radiance to them. âSaints in Heaven! Who are you?!â Nina gasps. âWhat are you doing to my children?!â

âI am Firestorm,â he explains. âI know the agonies your children have suffered. The littlest one still had glass embedded in her face. Iâve transmuted it to gas; it has escaped and now Iâm healing the tissue. She is healed - - save for the memories. I have done this for the memory of your husband.â

He turns towards Nina. âMemory?! Is he - - is Mikhail - - ?!â Nina asks in disbelief.

âJust remember. Your husband always loved you,â Firestorm answers. He lowers his molecular density, phases through the bedroom wall, and flies up into the night sky.

âI know. I believe that,â Nina says, watching through the window as Firestorm climbs. âJust as I fervently believe that - - someday - - Mikhail will return to me.â
name: Soul of Fire

description: "The Porcupine Man." Jerry and Tina McGee and Mason Trollbridge continue searching for Wally, whose speed had previously sent him careening out of control across the country. This issue has basically the same prickly cliffhanger ending as the previous issue.
name: The Porcupine Man

description:
In London, Mrs. Joan Talbot hears more bad news on her radio, and watches as the mailman approaches. She dreads his arrival, knowing that there'll be more hate mail for her husband Geoffrey along with all the bills and junk. Today a letter addressed to "Mr. Clean Bastard Talbot" threatens to disfigure Joan with razors if Geoffrey doesn't leave the sender alone. Joan already suffers from depression, and this letter is the last straw. She takes pain killers before slitting her wrists in the bath.

In Scotland, Marj writes to John Constantine of her safe arrival at the commune of the Pagan Nation. She marvels at how much more in tune with nature - how completely removed from civilization - these people are. She recounts a tale of how she had watched a woman sing for hours in the longhouse, and then that woman - Zed - had led them all in an orgy. Marj wishes that John had been there, and asks whether he has found Mercury yet.

In London, John returns to the Hotel Oscar Wilde, run by two homosexuals named Harold and Ken. They are interested by an article written by one of their own patrons named Simon Hughes, who seems to be investigating a series of suicides connected with Geotroniks. They also deliver Marj's letter, prompting a response.

John writes that he has not yet found Mercury, but that things are starting to move in the write direction. He tells of how he had run low on funds and was forced to sell a collection of rare Japanese pillow books to pay for his room at the hotel. Depressed by the loss, he decided to drown his sorrows at a terrible bar in Soho. There, he unexpectedly met with Detective Chief Inspector Geoffrey Talbot. Fortunately, Talbot seemed to have no interest in arresting John for the Paddington murders.

In fact, Talbot had become quite depressed over the pressure of being a good, clean cop when his compatriots are corrupt. He had begun to receive threatening hate mail and he faced either being transferred to traffic or getting sacked. John's interest was piqued when Talbot explained that he had been investigating corruption within the department and had discovered a secret black squad being run by Beales - a name John recognized as one of the men who was behind Mercury's kidnapping. John had helped Talbot home, only to find that his wife Joan had committed suicide.

Elsewhere, Mercury writes a diary of how she is being trained by Dr. Fulton to hone her psychic abilities. This includes using a device that uses ley lines to access the minds of people who are filled with fear, and then transferring that fear into a second device which stores it. Though Mercury has no problem dealing with the fears of others, the few glimpses she has seen of what is growing within the other device is beginning to scare her.

John decides to speak to Simon Hughes once his guest has left. The guest does not leave until late at night, but John cannot wait to find out what Simon knows about Geotroniks. He hears a sound from within the room, but no one answers. Eventually, he realizes that the sound is coming from in the wardrobe. Opening it, he finds Simon naked and hogtied, with a bag over his head.

-Source
name: The Fear Machine, Part V: Hate Mail & Love Letters

description: Terrorists take a school bus full of kids hostage. Who you gonna call? The Hero Hotline, of course...but can Microwavabelle handle it, knowing that her own children are among the hostages?

Blue Beetle tries to kill Max Lord!

Blue Beetle is on Monitor Duty when a phone call comes through and after Beetle answers it and has a odd conversation he proceeds into the kitchen. There he finds Max and Oberon, he then grabs a knife and stabs Oberon and Max. The screams bring Guy Gardner and Fire to see what the commotion is. Oberon stumbles out of the kitchen and able to utter "Beetle...Max... Knife" before passing out in Guys arms.

Guy leaves Oberon with Fire to check on the kitchen but Max and Beetle are gone and he is about to chase after them but Fire screams and Guy goes back to her. Meanwhile Max is trying to escape Beetle who is chasing him and ranting about not being a joke anymore. Beetle gets Max cornered but Max is saved by the Huntress.

She shot Beetle in his leg with her crossbow and knocks him down. She tries to help Max but then Batman shows up. He thinks Huntress caused the damage and instead of explaining what happened Huntress runs away. Batman is about to give chase but then Beetle comes to says "for my beloved Queen" and attacks Max again. Batman stops Beetle but Huntress is gone.

Back at the Embassy Max explains to Batman that Beetle must be mind controlled, even though he seems back to normal now they will need some help finding out whats going on with Beetle. Also they need to figure out what happened to Fire when she was with Oberon.

Note: This is the first time Huntress meets Batman
name: Slice and Dice! or "There's Something Very Wrong with the Blue Beetle!"

description: The League splits up into three groups to investigate Nazi organizations with links to metahuman activity. All groups are mistaken for NAZIs by some confused NAZI haters that are too easily defeated. The Elongated Man's twitching nose smells a mystery.
name: Somebody Up There Hates Us!

description: Sensor Girl has been elected the newest leader of the Legion of Super-Heroes, with Timber Wolf as her deputy leader. Before too long, things seem to go haywire on Earth. Monsters that shouldn't exist begin to show up. The weather patterns on the planet go haphazardly. Modern experts deduce that science won't take care of the problem and implore the Legion of Super-Heroes for assistance. Sensor Girl receives a message from Sorcerer's World, learning that the ways of magic are returning, dwarfing the impact of science.
name: When Magic Shall Return

description:
It's big trouble for little Atom as he faces both the power of a new villain, Edgâ¦and his ex-wife's new husband.

Note: First appearance of Edg the Destroyer.
name: Shrinking into the Fire!

description:
Still tracking his objects of power, Morpheus travels to Hell itself in search of his helmet. It seems itâs fallen into the hands of a higher demon, and thereâs a realm of devils standing between Morpheus and his propertyâ¦

Doctor Destiny escapes from Arkham Asylum forcing a passing motorist to take him to his ruby - Morpheus' Dreamstone - in a storage locker in the nearby town of Mayhew. Meanwhile Morpheus enlists the help of Scott Free (currently with the Justice League International) in his own search for the gem. Who will get to it first? And after so long is the item too powerful for either of them to wield?
name: Master of Dreams, Part 5 : Passengers

description:
1. Cover by Bill Wray.
  2. "Gorillas In Our Midst The Secret Origin of Gorilla City" written by Cary Bates and Greg Weisman, penciled by Carmine Infantino, inked by Mike DeCarlo, colored by Shelley Eiber and lettered by Agustin Mas.
  3. "The Legend of Congorilla" written by Tom Joyner, penciled by Fred Butler, inked by Kez Wilson, colored by Tatjana Wood and lettered by Janice Chiang.
  4. "IF U CN RD THS" scripted by Rusty Wells, plot and tardiness by Andy Helfer, penciled and inked by Mark Badger, colored by Robbie Busch and lettered by John Costanza.
  5. "Secrets Behind the Goofy Cover and Secrets Behind the Origins" A 1-1/10 page text piece on the histories of Gorilla City, Congorilla and Detective Chimp by unknown.

Note: Most characters have cameo appearances.

"Gorillas In Our Midst The Secret Origin of Gorilla City" - In 1873, a mental patient relates his story of a city populated by gorillas and a child-like alien to a reporter.

"The Legend of Congorilla" - Congo Bill relates a tale of gorillas and guerrillas; the first adventure of Congorilla.

"IF U CN RD THS" - Bobo solves his first ever crime.
name: Gorillas In Our Midst The Secret Origin of Gorilla City / The Legend of Congorilla / IF U CN RD THS

description: The era of Veto Skreemer will be a lot like today...only scarier. In the days after the fall of Western civilization a new order will rise, one dominated by the ruthless 'Presidents' of mob-style gangsters. Set in the devastated world of the near future, SKREEMER is the story of chaos and violence...a world where history has begun to repeat itself...a world where only the strong have any hope for survival. Veto Skreemer is such a man. He has a remarkable gift...and a terrible curse. Veto Skreemer was born on the very day that civilization died. SKREEMER is a hard-edged, fast-paced series that is at times realistic, at times over the edge of surrealism.
name: Part One: Souls to the Devil

1. Cover by Tom Artis and Keith Wilson.
  2. "Ghosts in the Machine Part 3 One World Wired" written by Doug Moench, penciled by Tom Artis, inked by Al Vey, colored by Robbie Busch and lettered by John Costanza.

description:
"Mr. Mxyzptlk! in As Good as His Word!". An all Lex Luthor issue! That mischievous imp, Mr. Mxyzptlk, is back in Metropolis. With the Man of Steel in a self-imposed exile in deep space who will stop him. Well, Lex Luthor has never been one to share his city. Plus, Luthor's Machiavellian scheming continues in "Hostile Takeover: Poison Pill!" Part 3 of 4.

Notes:

  • "As Good as His Word!" written by Roger Stern and Tom Peyer, penciled by Paris Cullins, inked by Dennis Janke, lettered by John Costanza and colored by Glenn Whitmore.
  • "Poison Pill!" written by Jerry Ordway, penciled by Dan Jurgens, inked by Dennis Janke, lettered by Albert De Guzman and colored by Glenn Whitmore.
  • Superman doesn't appear in this issue, however Mr. Mxyzptlk briefly takes the identity of Superman to scare Lex Luthor.
  • Laura Conway is not seen but is heard calling Morgan Edge on the phone.
  • The "Hostile Takeover" storyline is continued from Adventures of Superman #453.
  • The "Hostile Takeover" storyline continues in Adventures of Superman #454.
name: As Good As His Word! / Poison Pill!

description: Swamp Thing's journey through time continues as he encounters Tomahawk and other "Heroes of the Revolution" in 1776.
name: Heroes of the Revolution

description:
The final issue of writer Alan Moore and artist David Lloyd's acclaimed series! One may be able to kill a person, but an idea is bulletproof...

Chapter Titles

  • Book 3, Chapter 8: Vultures
  • Book 3, Chapter 9: The Vigil
  • Book 3, Chapter 10: The Volcano
  • Book 3, Chapter 11: Valhalla

Diana's imprisoned by a long-lost tribe of Amazons in Egypt, while the Cheetah lies sick in bed.

Wonder Woman, still on her quest to find her lasso is surrounded by armed warriors, and she doesnât know what do, and has no choice but to defend herself and is presented in front of Queen Anahid, the queen of the Amazons, but not as Diana knows them. They are the Amazons of Bana-Mighdall. Just as Queen Anahid orders her warriors to stop attacking Wonder Woman, the queen greets her with open arms. They shake hands just when the queen spits deadly venom onto Wonder Womanâs face, causing her legs to become paralysed and she falls to the floor.

Meanwhile, Chuma in Syene Kesh is searching for his master, Barbara Minerva and outside, he hears a man ranting about a woman stealing his money to the manager of the hotel. He makes his way up to Barbaraâs room and finds her on the bed, hung-over. She tells the story of her finding Amazons, but not like Wonder Woman.

With Wonder Woman, she is imprisoned and finds malnourished men. She gets up to try and help them but she herself has been weakened by the poison. She also meets a high priestess named Kadesha Banu and says the queen was surprised when she survived the poison and Wonder Woman must die!

Another plan is in motion has Queen Anahid asks her aide Assyra if the shells are ready and she replies that Colonel Hadal will be pleased.

Wonder Woman is in heavy chains as she finds herself weak and unable to stand. The high priestess Kadesha prepares her experiment on Wonder Woman but she hears a crash and turns around to see Wonder Woman. She cannot believe that Wonder Woman is still alive. Wonder Woman grabs the high priestess. The high priestess inhales sharply and realising what she is going to do, Wonder Woman throws her against the wall. She realises that the poison is still affecting her, because she had not meant to throw the high priestess that hard. She goes to see if she is alright, but finds that she is dead as she must have swallowed her own poison. Wonder Woman escapes but she is no closer to finding her lasso. Suddenly, she finds Nehebka dictating and grabs the tablet from her. Reading it, she finds one word in which she is familiar with: "Minerva". Looking up into the sky, it is also a full moon.
name: To Live by the Sword

description:
The Young All-Stars go head to head with Axis Amerika and Baron Blitzkrieg to prevent the first atomic bomb from being exploded in 1942.

Notes:

  • Story takes place on June 11 1942.
  • Green Lantern, the Guardian, Vigilante, Robotman, Hourman, Liberty Belle, Johnny Quick and Amazing Man headshot cameos.
name: Armageddon '42; Atom and Evil! Part V

description: Badger, Mavis, and Ham travel to the Amazon to help the Handmaidens of the Sacred Blood stop the corporation, Rotsaruck, LTD from destroying the rain forest.
name: Handmaidens of the Sacred Blood

description: One infant. One betrayal. Twelve turtles. One Banana Peel. By Peter David, Angel Medina and Sam Grainger . Plus, the first installment of Pawns, an original science fiction novel by Jim Starlin and Daina Graziunas , with illustrations by Starlin.
name: Baby on Board

description:
Wrath of the Dreamqueen: Part 4

Alpha Flight battles against Dreamqueen in a final confrontation. Using her ability of illusions, Dreamqueen is able to deter her foes until Talisman arrives. Laura Dean opens a portal behind Dreamqueen and Talisman punches her through, leaving her stuck in another realm. The members decide that Alpha Flight needs to continue as a team, as Talisman predicts that there is more evil to come.
name: ...Is But A Dream Within A Dream

description:
The return of Venom! After breaking out of the Vault, Spider-Manâs most pervasive foe makes his bid for vengeance. Howâs Hydro-Man involved? Plus, Peter makes an unsettling discovery about Aunt Mayâs beau!

After their eviction from Bedford Towers, Peter and Mary Jane move in with Aunt May in Queens until they can find another place to live.

Plot

Peter takes pictures of himself as Spider-Man stopping Hydro-Man from robbing a construction site. As he makes his way to Aunt May's house to develop the pictures, he recalls the events that led to this point in time. Mary Jane's abduction, the discovery that their landlord Jonathon Caesar was responsible, and the subsequent eviction from their condo by the jilted admirer. The current obstacle involves using their remainder savings to pay legal costs to fight their eviction and recoup the money invested in the condo.

After he develops the film, he agrees to go with MJ to Manhattan to drop off his photos at the Daily Bugle while she participates in a fashion show. On the way out he notices Nathan Lubensky going through May's purse. Peter realizes something is wrong but says nothing.

Later after he gets paid for his photos, Peter (as Spider-Man) swings past the Queensboro bridge and notices Nathan at a nearby ATM. He's screaming at the machine for preventing him taking more than $500 per day. Peter changes and confronts Nathan. He tells him he knows he took May's bank card and demands to know what's happening.

Nathan admits - indirectly - that he has a gambling problem. Recently he amassed a huge debt to a loan shark who is demanding $5,000 of it now as a sign of good faith. Nathan had planned to use the money from the house account to and pay it back later. Peter allows him to keep the money but takes the card from him. He uses the money from the photos to replace the money Nathan took. When they return to Queens, Peter discovers MJ didn't get the modeling gig.

Later that night, Nathan ventures out once again. This time he has a guardian spider keeping tabs on him. He meets some "representatives" of the loan shark that threaten him when he doesn't have the money owed. When Nathan exhausts his bag of tricks (which consist of common household items) to defend himself, Spider-Man appears and makes quick work of the three assailants, webbing them to a basketball goal. He quickly leaves, reappearing as Peter. He (rather his automatic camera) has taken pictures of the entire ordeal and promises to take them to the district attorney's if they threaten Nathan again.

As they walk home, Peter gets Nathan to promise to quit gambling. However the next day at the newstand he is unable to resist purchasing a dozen lottery tickets.

While all of this is happening, Venom escapes from the Vault out in Colorado and makes his way toward New York for a showdown with Spider-Man.
name: A Matter Of Life And Debt

description: The West Coast Avengers, the Avengers, the Fantastic Four, and Quasar together in the final - and we mean final - battle against Super-Nova!
name: Reckoning

description: When Darkstar, Ursa, and Vangaurd fall into a coma after being betrayed by the other Soviet Super Soldiers, Captain America must travel to Russia to stop what would be the next World War!
name: The Great Bear

description: Can Mastodon pull Scuzz out of the clutches of a deadly cult or is it already too late? Plus, Randy and Charly come to an understanding about their relationship. Includes the Official Timeline of the New Universe.
name: Cult / Crackdown

description:
Who does the world call on in the wake of super hero disasters? Meet the Clean-Up Op that handles the messes no one else wants to touch! Where thereâs property damageâ¦thereâs Damage Control! Creator Dwayne McDuffie introduces you to the cast of characters responsible for keeping the Marvel Universe clean. It all starts here!

It's account executive John Porter's first day on the job at Damage Control. Meanwhile, The Avengers are on hand to take down the Tinkerer's robot which is threatening Manhattan. Their battle leaves the giant robot leaned up against the Twin Towers and Damage control is called in to clean it up.
name: A Restoration Comedy

person_credits.name: Ernie Colon
person_credits.role: penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover, other

description:
Daredevil drinks alone on Christmas Eve. Fellow patrons at the bar share tales of loneliness, heartbreak, and regret. A seductive barfly isn't what she seems. Ann Nocenti's Daredevil at its best- dream-like, dizzying, and positively stunning!

Daredevil is in a bar on Christmas Eve when he is approached by a beautiful woman. She hits on him and talks to him about desire, all the while keeping him distracted from what else happens in the bar. It is too late for Daredevil to notice that two brothers are fighting at one of the tables and the one brother kills the other. When Daredevil realizes what is happening, the woman turns into Mephisto, and reveals that his Christmas gift to Daredevil is the gift of uselessness in the face of true evil. He then throws Daredevil out of the bar where he is helped to his feet by two bums, who treat him with kindness, and make Daredevil realize there is still good in the world
name: The Devil You Say !

description: Bruce Banner is talked into attending a movie convention by Marlo as she works as a booth model, where he attempts to warn Marlo of the dangers of being close to Joe. However she quickly accuses him of being simply jealous,with Bruce rushing back to Mr. Fixit's penthouse before the night triggers his change.However upon changing he quickly is given control of Berengetti's empire, hires Ben Grimm and various other heroes to work for him, meets Marlo and Betty who both agree to share him,runs over the Leader and begins to beat Banner who urges Hulk that he is being tricked.He then awakens back in his penthouse where he meets Glorian, and angrily throws him out the window. However Glorian quickly saves himself through use of a rainbow with Hulk pursuing him back to the convention center. He then beats him to death, as a horrified Marlo walks away realizing Bruce was right about Joe.
name: Now You See It...

description: The Mandarin challenges Tony Stark to a winner takes all match! If he wins, Stark Enterprises is free to open up shop in Hong Kong. But if he loses, the Iron Avenger must work exclusively for the Mandarin â forever!
name: Master Blaster!

description:
Story #1 - The Retribution Affair Part 2 - Cyclops - Journeying to Muir Island at the request of an old friend, Cyclops find's himself attacked by an unseen adversary. He discovers Moira MacTaggert is deeply involved in whatever is happening on the island. In an attempt to investigate what is going on he becomes more involved in a strange and deadly mystery.

Story #2 - Panther's Quest Part 6 - Black Panther - Since he's arrived in South Africa T'challa has defended himself against mercenaries and South African security forces. He's come to learn if a curio shop owner named Patrick Slade really knows if the mother he hasn't seen since he was a child is still alive. Zanti Chikane, a gold miner, reluctantly gives the barbed wire gouged and bloodied Panther aid. But this is a place imminently hostile, not only to the great cat.

Story #3 - X Mas Tease - She Hulk - The She Hulk has a case of the Christmas Blues, so she calls up Ben Grimm and dreams up some things to brighten her day, such as a fight with some super villains such as Doctor Doom, Magneto and Galactus but she realizes this could ruin Christmas for everyone else so instead she opens her Christmas presents and it turns out the whole story was a plug for her new book.

Story #4 - A Christmas Card - Willie Lumpkin - A plodding, pixilated postman from the midwest, Willie Lumpkin never dreamed he would one day deliver mail to the super hero family the Fantastic Four. Tonight however on Christmas Eve the good natured Willie must save his immortal soul from a misdirected spirit's art of redemption alone!!
name: Retribution Affair (Part 2); Panther's Quest (Part 6); X-Mas Tease...; A Christmas Card;

description: Jessie Wilcox, the beloved author of the Goo Gams books, is in trouble. Her latest book had a million dollar treasure hunt, but the prize money went missing, and she's being accused of fraud. Katie and Jack (who saved Wilcox in issue #21), ask the Punisher and Dakota North to get to the bottom of the issue. They discover that thieves have stolen the prize money, and they pose as Goo Gam "ghosts" to terrorize them and convince them to turn themselves in.
name: The Great Goo-Gam Rip-Off!

description: After helping a choking woman while on a stakeout who is eventually murdered, Punisher must Punisher travel to Australia in pursuit of the killer. Armed with a camel and some weapons, the Outback proves to be just as tough an opponent as the former ANZAC turner drug dealer for Punisher.
name: "The Spider"

description: Punisher returns to the war zone to take out Sniper, the ex-vet madman whoâs been killing members of his Vietnam unit. But will Frank Castle be the next hit? The armoryâs locked and loaded, and so is the Punisher.
name: Crucible

description:
Namor gives us a detailed account of his origin story.
Â 
This chapter finds us as Namor is still without memories and living as a vagrant in New York City. Coincidentally, Human Torch (of the Fantastic Four) runs into him and helps him regain his memories. Namor falls in love with Invisible Woman and his various attempts to woo her are shown to us here.
Â 
Eventually, Namor returns to Atlantis to find it moved. His journey for his home comes to a head as he finds out his mother and grandfather are dead. Byrrah has taken the throne and Krang his old friend Dorma.
Â 
The people of Atlantis welcome Namor home with open arms and Dorma leaves Krang. Namor is now the leader of Atlantis.
name: Rage and Remembrance

description:
She-Hulk is at a circus, testing her strength by lifting two elephants into the air. The circus offered to let her use their grounds as a training area. The resident strongman comments on how impressive Jen's display is, but she comments that it is nothing for someone who can bench press seventy five tons. She also mentions that her cousin, the Hulk, hid out in a circus much like this one, back in issue #1 of the Avengers comic. Bruno says that he had heard rumors about her being the Hulk's cousin, but never knew if they were true. Jen confirms that they are, but that she hasn't made a point of revealing the details of her life to the world, even though she doesn't have a secret identity. Suddenly, a voice calls out "Perhaps you'd care to tell us all about it now, Ms. Walters...." She-Hulk turns to see who spoke--and looks right into the hypnotic effect of the Ringmaster's hat! She-Hulk has fallen into the trap of the Circus of Crime, and is now their mindless slave! The Clown reminds Ringmaster of the three million dollars they were offered...but the Ringmaster silences him. "That money is as good as in the bank, but we will earn it in a manner of âmyâ choosing! The Circus of Crime may be for hire...but only on âmyâ terms!"

Elsewhere, a group of scientists are monitoring the Circus. One of them comments that he is uncomfortable with employing felons, but his colleague reminds him that the Circus is only presumed felons--no charges have ever been made to stick to them. Besides, he says, it isn't like they were going to act on their own against someone as powerful as She-Hulk. The man with glasses comments that he is worried about how "he" is going to react--pointing at some non-humanoid creature in the next room. His colleague says that he isn't concerned about that.

Back at the circus, Ringmaster has She-Hulk tell them of her origin. She first tells them of how her cousin Bruce became the Hulk, and then how years later he had to give her a blood transfusion to save her life, which ended up transforming her into the She-Hulk. She then goes on to mention her membership in the Avengers and Fantastic Four, and how she is now permanently locked in She-Hulk form. Ringmaster says he has heard enough, and that it is time to move on to phase 2 of the plan. He has the Professor, their make-up expert, begin his work...and two hours later, She-Hulk has been transformed into "Glamazonia"! He has covered her with flesh-tone make-up to make her appear human again, and given her a red wig. As the men admire the Professor's work, Princess Python storms in and demands to know what is going on! She is supposed to be the sex appeal for their group, and she is not happy to see another woman added to the act. Ringmaster assures her that Glamazonia is only a temporary addition, and that she'll understand better tonight.

That night, the audience arrives for a free show. As the people arrive and take their seats, they notice that only one stand of bleachers is open, and that the seats have seatbelts. Once everyone is seated and buckled in, the Ringmaster starts the showâand Glamazonia lifts up the bleachers and carries the audience around the room! Then the Ringmaster zaps the audience with his hypnotic hat, putting them all into a trance. Then Glamazonia tips the bleachers upside down, so that all of their wallets, purses and jewelry fall out! Zelda is impressed--it is the same scheme that the Circus usually pulls, only now they don't have to go up into the stands to steal all the booty. It is now faster and easier for them. Glamazonia puts the audience back in their place, and the Ringmaster hypnotizes them all into believing that they have just seen the greatest show on Earth! The audience departs, raving about the show, and none of the wiser of having been robbed!

The Circus counts their loot, and the Ringmaster comments that they will do even better the next night, when they have a whole tent full of victims. Suddenly, a circus wagon comes rolling straight at them! The men dive for cover, but She-Hulk instinctively shatters it with a punch!

Elsewhere, the scientist with glasses is concerned about this development. He is worried about She-Hulk's body getting damaged. His colleague agrees, and puts on his gorilla disguise, so he can get more personally involved.

He arrives at the circus to find the Ringmaster accusing Zelda of sending the wagon at them, since she was the one who didn't want Glamazonia around! Zelda points out that she was on the opposite end of the big top when it happened, but Ringmaster suggests she could have charmed someone else into doing it for her. Bruno glances out the window and sees the gorilla! He warns the others that one of the gorillas has escaped, and Ringmaster sends Glamazonia to retrieve it before someone alerts the authorities. As She-Hulk gives chase, Bruno remembers that this circus doesn't have any gorillas!

The gorilla leaps over She-Hulk, and grabs the Ringmaster's hat off his head! Then he uses it to break the hypnotic spell that Jen is under! She-Hulk instantly loses all interest in the gorilla, allowing him to escape unnoticed! She-Hulk recognizes the Ringmaster, and realizes that this must be the Circus of Crime! The criminals try to flee, but Jen throws a wagon in the air, and it lands in their path, blocking their path! They turn and run a different way, but She-Hulk tosses barrels in their way. Then to finish them off, she rips the bars off one of the cages, and throws them like javelins. They land in a circle around the circus members, caging them in! Jen figures that will hold them while she calls the cops, but just then the cops arrive!

Later, at the police station, a female officer brings Jennifer some clothes to change into, as she washes the last of the body make-up off. The officer congratulates She-Hulk. She says that she may be the first person to make a charge stick against the Circus of Crime! She also tells Jen that when Ringmaster tried to pin the attempted murder with the wagon on Princess Python, the Professor confessed to it. Apparently he had a crush on Zelda, and tried to kill Jen as a way of apologizing for his role in setting Jen up as Zelda's replacement. She-Hulk asks if she can speak to the prisoners--she wants to find out why they went to all the trouble of capturing and hypnotizing her. The Ringmaster informs her that they were offered three million dollars to test the extent of She-Hulk's strength and invulnerability. Jen asks who hired them, but the Ringmaster doesn't know; all arrangements were handled through third parties. Jennifer is less than thrilled. "Oh, great! Some anonymous bad guy is ready to spend three million bucks to find out how tough I am...and I know how these things work! It'll be at least my third issue before I find out who it is!"

Elsewhere, the man with the glasses, Morgan, reveals that it was he who called the police, to prevent She-Hulk from getting injured. It also gave Nagan the opportunity to slip away undetected. As Nagan removes his gorilla mask, he comments that the Ringmaster getting arrested saves them from having to pay him the three million. Now they can use that money to hire someone else to continue the testing. "She-Hulk is still of great interest to...the Headmen!" Nagan hands Ringmaster's hat off to Ruby. Morgan says that they ahve to learn more about the She-Hulk if they are going to bring any solace to their friend Chondu.
name: Second Chance

description:
The Silver Surfer senses a planet he once saved from Galactus is in danger. He finds the people of the planet deliberately destroying their planet. They tell him they were trying to get his attention and that they would rather die than be killed by the dragon.

Surfer asks them about this dragon. They claim it has killed thousands and thousands of them. He sets out to find it and destroy it.

He is ambushed when the dragon fires and seems to teleport but the Surfer manages to sense where he will be and destroys it's teleportation device. The creature flees but Surfer uses his infrared vision and sees it's path. He overpowers the creature and tells it to surrender but it will not.

The dragon tells the Surfer what he and his whole race escaped their sun going nova. It had damaged their cazalyte crystals that powered their engines. They all landed on this planet for assistance. They asked for the crystals politely but they brought them something else that they called Kortilon. They said it worked just as good. When it was installed in their ships it set off a chain reaction killing all four billion of his kind. He was away when it happened and witnessed the people cheering that their land was saved from the dragons.

He vowed vengeance ever since killing as many as he could. Surfer tells him that the killing stops here. The dragonÂ  tells him to stop him he will have to kill him. Still no match for the him, the Surfer pleads with him not to make him do this. He tries to tranform him instead, to render his power useless, but it does not work and he accidentally makes the dragon explode, killing it.

The people cheer for the Surfer, be he tells them that never in is travels has he met people as hate filled and violent as they were.
name: Alien

description: The Texas Twister is back. He's possessed by a blood-mad demon! How can Hawkeye stop his tornado-powered rampage? Plus: The Vision must use logic to defeat a murderous madman. But the paradox is that to win, the Vision must use methods that defy logic!
name: When You Wish Upon A Star; Will You, Won't You

description: The shocking verdict of Joe Robertson's trial is in - Robbie's guilty! Meanwhile Spidey has to deal with a simmering gang war between the Lobo Brothers and the Kingpin; plus a werewolf is prowling the streets!
name: Guilty!

description: Robbieâs parents are under a lot of pressure due to their past involvement with Alex Bow and trying to keep it a secret. And all of the pressure is affecting Robbie. So he tries to help solve the mystery of Alex Bow in âThe Hidden Past.â
name: The Hidden Past

description:
JAMES D. HUDNALL (W) â¢ MARK BAGLEY (A)

The government is about to be betrayed and overthrown! The Morituri are all either dead, in prison, or working for the enemy! Who remains that can save mankind? The answer is a shocker!
name: Dead Reckoning

description: The Executioner, mind controlled by Amora, seeks to kill the Mighty Thor!
name: When the Executioner Calls!

description:
Introducing Jubilee! A young mutant teenager is creating her own fireworks in an L.A mall for money. But her burgeoning abilities have attracted the attention of a few unhappy patrons, among them mutant hunters! Will a few X-Men on a shopping spree be able to save the young Jubilee? The introduction to one of Marvel's most beloved mutants!

Storm, Psylocke, Rogue, and Dazzler go to the Beverley Hill's Mall, and encounter a mutant with the power to make "puffs" like fireworks, named Jubilation Lee. The x-women save her from being captured by the M-squad, who were hired to capture Jubilation, because of her cunning ways of living in the mall. Nevertheless, she was saved from the M-squad and left with x-ladies.
name: Ladies' Night

description:
It's a giant-sized anniversary issue! But Spidey sure doesn't have anything to celebrate about. He's been photographed "stealing" a valuable jewel by the unscrupulous Nick katzenberg. When the news hits the front page, everyone tries to find out the truth. And when we say everyone, we mean: Prowler, Puma, Rocket Racer, Sandman, Silver Sable, and Will-O'-The-Wisp! As if that weren't headache enough for Spidey, unknown to him, J. Jonah Jameson has been "replaced" - by the Chameleon!

Synopsis

J. Jonah Jameson is sure he must be dreaming. Tabloid paparazzo Nick Katzenberg has just walked into his office with a half a dozen great photos of Spider-Man stealing jewelry and he's willing to give them away in exchange for being put on salary at $800 a week. Jonah is so happy that, leaving the office, he tells Joy Mercado "you're a beautiful woman", gives Glory Grant a kiss on the cheek, and tells a visiting Eduardo Lobo to "stop by anytime". He is still riding high when he gets to his apartment. He opens the door and walks right into a spray of gas that knocks him unconscious. A mysterious intruder is very pleased by this result.

The Daily Bugle runs one of the photos on the front page under a headline that reads "Spider-Man: Thief?" But the Arranger is interested in a different part of the paper as he rides in the back of his limo. He is reading an article headlined, "New Gang War?" and he is not pleased. He is well aware that it is the Lobos who have been killing the Kingpin's lieutenants and this concerns him, but he is more concerned by the adverse publicity. The limo lets him out at the West Side Marina where more murders have taken place. Again there is blood everywhere and a message has been written. This time it is on the prow of a yacht and says, "Wolves take revenge." Detective Frank Farrow is on the scene and he tells the Arranger that he wants the killings stopped. Just then, a goon in a white suit and shades yells out, "Arranger! Call on your car phone!" (What good does it do the Arranger to continually insist to Frank Farrow that he is the employee of an honest businessman if some white suited goon is going to refer to him as "Arranger"?)

The Arranger goes back to his car and takes the call. The voice on the phone introduces itself as "Carlos Lobos, senor, the man you tried to assassinate not too long ago" (way back where we started in Spectacular Spider-Man #143). The scene shifts to an unshaven Carlos sitting on a snowy balcony and sipping champagne as he talks on the phone. He tells the Arranger that the Lobos never planned to expand their drug operations into the Kingpin's territory as the Arranger feared when he okayed the hit on Carlos, but now it is too late. He quotes the last blood message. "Wolves take revenge," he says. Carlos hangs up, then turns to his brother and speaks to him in Spanish. A peevish Eduardo tells Carlos to speak English since "we are not in Mexico anymore". Carlos asks his brother how his new lover Gloria is. "She is mine," says Eduardo, "and when the time comes, she will do exactly what I tell her."

It turns out that, in robbing the jewels, Spider-Man was working for Silver Sable in an apprehension of a Maggia Money Man. When Peter brings photos to the Bugle that proves this, JJJ refuses to buy them. He only wants photos that show Spider-Man in a bad light, truth be damned. If this doesn't sound quite like Jonah, no matter how much he hates Spider-Man, it's because it isn't Jonah. The real Jameson has his hands tied to his bedposts at home and the man who is impersonating him at work is the Chameleon.
name: 1000 Words

description:
In part three of the 'Vision Quest Saga', the team must reconcile with a newly constructed Vision. Will Scarlet Witch find the automaton she loves in Vision 2.0?

Various mutants appear on TV screens only being assessed as potential hosts for That Which Endures. They do not make an actual appearance. The mutants shown include: Angel/Archangel, Apocalypse, Avalanche, Banshee, Beast, Blob, Caliban, Callisto, Cannonball, Black Tom Cassidy, Cloak, Colossus, Cyclops, Cypher, Dagger, Dazzler, Destiny, Firestar, Forge, Havok, Iceman, Karma, Legion, Madrox the Multiple Man, Magik, Magma, Magneto, Malice/Polaris, Mandrill, Marvel Girl/Jean Grey, Mastermind, Mesmero, Mystique, Nekra, Nightcrawler, Phoenix/Rachel Summers, Pyro, Quicksilver, Rogue, Sabra and Sabretooth. Scarlet Witch is also depicted but does appear within the issue. Karma is incorrectly colored with redhair leading to her being misidentified by readers as Moira MacTaggert or Madelyne Pryor - neither of whom would fit the alphabetical ordering or are mutants.
name: Better a Widow...

description: X-Factor vows to return all the children kidnaped by Nanny and Orphan -Maker. The trouble is, Nanny and Orphan-Maker have an iron-cld plan to not only stop them, but destroy them!
name: Dust to Dust

description:
Reprints Bad Company from weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Tom Lyle (Bad Company)

  • Bad Company - book two: The Bewilderness (parts 2-3) (prog 549-550) (Peter Milligan - Brett Ewins and Jim McCarthy)
  • Project Overkill (parts 3-5) (progs 121-123) (Kelvin Gosnell - Jesus Redondo)
  • The Mean Arena - The Southampton Sharks (parts 14-15) (progs 197-198) (Tom Tully - John Richardson)
name: Bad Company 10

description:
Jaka tries to make things better about what Rick said about Cerebus (Fred), but makes things worse. Oscar is going to paint a guffin.

Flashback: Jaka doesn't like what she finds in the room, plus she has to hide there from Nurse.
name: Jaka's Story 9

description:
More of Mister Miracle's relatives--also known as The Forever People--come for a visit!

In spite of the previous issue's sudden intrusion by the Forever People, Scott and Barda's dinner goes reasonably well with the assistance of some of Highfather and Beautiful Dreamer's illusionary powers. Unhappy with his surprise guests, Miracle steps outside in a huff only to be clubbed unconscious by a pair of shadow-possessed neighborhood boys.

Back at home, Barda and the remaining house guests exchange various domestic arguments in regards to child rearing, pregnancy, and dealing with spontaneous visitors.

Scott, it is revealed, has been kidnapped by Fyre, a female entity that has been doing her best to push humanity onto the wrong paths since the dawn of time. Miracle attempts an escape only to be subdued by a pair of shadows posing as neighborhood children. Vykin, Moonrider, and Serafan are subsequently captured, and Fyre sends the two neighborhood children to lure Barda and Highfather into a trap
name: Dark Days

description:
Classic reprints from British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Rich Larson and Sam De La Rosa (Zenith)

  • Zenith - phase one: Tygers (epilogue) (prog 550) (Grant Morrison - Steve Yeowell)
  • Zenith - Interlude (part 1) (prog 558) (Grant Morrison - Steve Yeowell)
  • Inferno (parts 16-17) (progs 51-52) (Tom Tully - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Meltdown Man (parts 17-18) (progs 194-195) (Alan Hebden - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Return to Armageddon (part 14) (prog 198) (Malcolm Shaw - Jesus Redondo)
name: 2000AD Showcase 38

description:
Reprints Slaine and Ukko's adventures from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Randy Elliott (Slaine)

  • Slaine - The King (parts 11-12 - final part) (progs 518-519) (Pat Mills - Glenn Fabry)
  • Slaine - The King (prologue) (prog 582) (Angie Kincaid - Glenn Fabry)
  • Slaine - The King: mini-series (part 1) (prog 589) (Pat Mills - Glenn Fabry)
  • Judge Dredd (reprint from the Daily Star newspaper) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ron Smith)
  • Moon Runners (parts 4-5) (progs 594-595) (Steve Parkhouse and Alan McKenzie - Massimo Belardinelli)
  • Luke Kirby - Summer Magic (part 4) (prog 574) (Alan McKenzie - John Ridgway)
name: Slaine the King 25

description:
Classic Judge Dredd reprints from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Tom Lyle (Judge Dredd)

  • The Graveyard Shift (parts 6-7 - final part) (progs 340-341) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ron Smith)
  • The Weather Man (progs 329-330) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ron Smith)
  • Pieromania (prog 350) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Kim Raymond)
name: Judge Dredd 32

description:
The New Mutants stood in the ruins of their school (it was destroyed in X-FactorÂ #39 & Uncanny X-MenÂ #243). Â They had no idea what had happened and suspected Magneto. Â Wolfsbane struggled to understand Illyana as she only spoke Russian. Â Mirage's valkyrie ability to see the death glow indicated that there was someone trapped underneath the rubble. Â Sunspot lifted up a huge segment of wall, but was suddenly attacked by Sabretooth who had been trapped underneath. Â Cannonball's quick thinking and blasting power pushed Sabretooth away. Â He fell weak agains tthe floor and introduced himself. Â Sabretooth's voice faded away and Warlock pronounced that he had died, but Mirage wasn't so sure since she didn't see Death come to collect him. Â However, the others reminded her that her valkyrie powers had been acting up and she admitted that she still had an intense headache.

Suddenly the Inner Circle of the Hellfire Club arrived. Â Although they were hovering several feet above the New Mutants, Sunspot picked up a large metallic pillar from the remains and hurled it at Magneto while pronouncing that they would no longer listen to him. Â Magneto easily swept the debris aside in mid air, and Sebastian Shaw descended to the ground to tackle Sunspot one-on-one. Â He knocked Sunspot backwards. Â Cannonball flew at Shaw, but flew into a metal wall that Magneto constructed. Â Selene stood over Cannonball's collapsed body, but instead of draining his life-force her own body became withered and grey. Â It was a physical manifestation of her greatest fear courtesy of Mirage's mutant power, but the White Queen telepathically attacked her. Â Being a creature of living circuitry, Warlock was immune to the White Queen's powers and shocked her with a fierce alien shape. Â 

The fight between the New Mutants and the Inner Circle came to an end when Magneto wrapped them up in a giant metallic ball constructed from the remains of the school. Â He demanded to know who the little girl was, and where Magik had got to. Â When Illyana spoke in Russian he immediately realised who she was and was outraged. Â The New Mutants did their best to explain how the Darkchilde had sacrificed herself (see New MutantsÂ #73) and that they intended to leave Magneto's school. Â They confronted him with the knowledge that he had been talking with N'astirh during the Infero and had over-heard other things (such as the power inhibitors he authorised in New MutantsÂ #67).

Shaw seized upon the opportunity. Â He declared that without any students, Magneto had nothing and should therefore be cast out of the Hellfire Club.He struck Magneto and started another fight (see the previous issue). Â Mangeto fell backwards, but sent a hail of metallic debris flying at Shaw. Â Shaw lifted the ground from under Magneto's feet, but the Master of Magnetism flew out of harms way. Â He then made the floor curl into a long club and rammed Shaw with it. Â All the while Magneto ranted about how he recognised that he could not teach the New Mutants in the same methods that Charles Xavier had established. Â From trapped inside their metallic bubble the New Mutants suddenly understood that why Magneto's attitude towards them had changed so drastically; the he was grooming them to be his personal army. Â He did not require their love, he just wished to keep them from any foolish heroics that would possibly kill them, as had happened with the X-Men in Dallas. Â The New Mutants were convinced not to trust Magneto any more.

The fight between Shaw and Magneto raged on. Â Shaw continued to absorb the kinetic energy and would break free from any metallic prison that Magneto would wrap around him. Â Shaw considered all mutant teams such as Alpha Flight, Marauders, X-Men and even the Gonshan mutates as major investments to make. Â Magneto raged that the mutates of genosha would rise up and overthrown their human masters. Â He wanted mutants to fight other mutants to winnow out the foolish heroics. Â He was more concerned with battling the legends of martyrs like the X-Men, and taunted Shaw that he wasn't a legend.

However, Shaw had secretly placed a device in his suit to reverse the magnetic polarity in the area, sending Magneto flying backwards through the air. Â He landed near the New Mutants' metallic prison, and Warlock considered breaking out to help his former headmaster. Â Cannonball reminded him that after everything they'd heard, Magneto was as dangerous and villainous as the rest of the Hellfire Club. Â As Shaw stood over Magneto, Magneto declared that it was time to recruit a new army. Â With that, he buried them both in a barrage of metal. Â At first Selene thought he'd killed himself and Shaw, but moments later the debris cleared away and Magneto emerged carrying Shaw's unconscious body. Â He had over-loaded Sebastian Shaw's ability to absorb energy.

Shaw was tossed on the floor, from where he declared that Magneto should be expelled from the Hellfire Club. Â Naturally Magneto claimed that it should be Shaw who should be removed. Â When asked for her vote, the White Queen recalled the Nimrod that had killed Leland & Von Roehm and that such a machine had obviously been connected with the Sentinel programme that Shaw had invested in. Â Therefore she sided with Magneto. Â The deciding vote was passed to Selene, and the White Queen reminded her that without Shaw's interference she would be able to rule over the Amazon region. Â Therefore Selene voted against Sebastian Shaw, while continuing to plot against the White Queen. Â Sebastian Shaw stormed away from the site of Xavier's School for the Gifted. Â Magneto then dictated that there would Â not be another Black King to replace Shaw. Â Instead he would merge the positions of White & Black King to become the first Grey King of the Hellfire Club.

Magneto then turned his attention back to the New Mutants. Â Still trapped inside the metal sphere they rejected his leadership. Â Magneto lifted his hand and used his power on the metal cage. Â To their surprise, he let them go free. Â He gave them a final speech on how he hoped they would join him in time. Â Sunspot cried that they would never join him, but Magneto taunted him saying that Sunspot would be the first to change his mind.

Warlock transformed into a helicopter and flew the New Mutants away from their destroyed school. Â The White Queen telepathically spoke with Magneto saying that the New Mutants knew a little of their involvement in South America. Â He was pleased to have his suspicions confirmed, but was confident that the New Mutants didn't know exactly what they were planning. Â They also telepathically schemed to remove Selene from her position of Black Queen, even though she was stood next to them.
name: King Of The Hill!

description:
Story #1 The Retribution Affair Part 3 - Cyclops - Cyclops finds himself in the middle of a deadly mystery. Moira MacTaggert is under the hypnotic control of the mutant hating sentinel known as Master Mold, at his bidding she has been performing mysterious experiments upon two local children. Now one hovers near death and soon all mutantkind may face extermination.

Story #2 - Panther's Quest Part 7 - Black Panther - The Black Panther's meeting with Patrick Slade, a curio shop owner, has been violently interrupted by mercenaries led by Elmer "Sex N' Violence" Gore. Zanti Chikane has become a less than enthusiastic companion to the Panther, especially since the Panther's unauthorized presence in South Africa has already made television news and prompted Magistrate of communications, Anton Pretorius, to promise that the Nationalist Government will make every effort to hunt the Panther down.

Story #3 - Nightmare In Suburbia Part 1 - Dr. Strange - Dr. Strange has detected a demon in the small town of Minerva Ohio but what he thought would be a simple task of banishing it turns out to be more trouble than he thought.

Story #4 - Overture - Damage Control - First Appearance Of Damage Control - When a clash of super powered being happens, Damage Control is who you call when it's over to pick up the pieces.
name: Retribution Affair (Part 3); Panther's Quest (Part 7); Nightmare In Suburbia (Part 1); Overture;

description:
Story #1 - The Retribution Affair Part 4 - Cyclops - While under the influence of the sinister Master Mold, Dr. Moira MacTaggert has created a genetically engineered virus designed to destroy mutants. It is a virus that has already claimed two victims, a young girl and the former X Man, Sean Cassidy. Now these two have been kidnapped by Master Mold's robot servitors and their only hope for survival lies with Scott Summers, the man called Cyclops.

Story #2 - Panther's Quest Part 8 - Black Panther - Sarah Slade tells the Black Panther she has not seen her husband, Patrick, but that knowledge of the Panther's missing mother prompted him to some wild scheme. The Panther is unaware that a man on a nearby rooftop has been spying on Slade's curio store and reports the Panther's arrival to Elmer "Sex N' Violence" Gore. Shortly thereafter South African troops assault the town with tear gas.

Story #3 - Nightmare In Suburbia Part 2 - Dr. Strange - With an almost casual disinterest Dr. Strange has investigated a minor demonic presence in Minerva Ohio. He has discovered that the dimensional disruption reaches farther and deeper than he had ever anticipated, it reaches into other realms and into a family's innocent heart.

Story #4 - At The Bottom of My Garden - Clea - Clea finds that the monsters of the Dark Dimension have a weakness for beauty.
name: Retribution Affair (Part 4); Panther's Quest (Part 8); Nightmare In Suburbia (Part 2); At The Bottom Of My Garden;

The Elementals continue their battle with The Rapture in the Rocky Mountains. It starts to look like The Elementals will have the upper hand, until The Rapture get smart and use their powers against those members they will be most effective against.

Jeremy Skaggs's secret regarding the origin of The Rapture is leaked out to the press by his former assistant Dawn Moore. He holds a press conference and attempts to cover things up. Meanwhile, F.I.S.H. has decided its time to close in on the reverend.

In Philadelphia, Captain Cadaver is still loose and racking up the body count.

description:
Atlantis's hero Aquaman returns from a journey which has kept him from the city for months, only to find 3 Atlanteans dead and a outpost destroyed spurring him to race back to his kingdom.On his journey home he finds yet another outpost has been destroyed with soldiers dead. Aquaman then arrives to his city, to find it invaded with the invaders dismantling the Atlantis salt mines, which are Atlantis's number one trade product to the surface world.

Aquaman then allows himself the be captured for answers, awakening in a prison cell for political prisoners. Flashbacks then reveal Vulko's death, while Pletus vied for the throne with the army backing a mentally ill Mera, who slipped slowly into insanity over the death of her son, until forced to be put into an asylum, while Aqualad vowed to stay out of the situation.

Pletus was set to rule until the invaders arrived, with the General assumed power until killed in the battle, with Pletus finally assuming power. Pletus eventually grew mad with power, executing his own troops before finally surrendering to the enemy and being executed. The jelly fish invaders are then revealed as the enemy, with a plan from humans set to wipe out the Atlanteans.

Mera in her asylum room then feels Aquaman's return to Atlantis, demanding to be let out. Meanwhile Aquaman attempts his escape, only to be confronted by another prisoner intent on using him in exchange for his freedom. After overcoming his opponent, it is then revealed that the minimal security unit is in fact the cover for the resistance movement.
name: Aquarium
